body:
# raylib_pong

A game where you try to get the ball past the opponents paddle

## Installation

1. Install raylib from [github](https://github.com/raysan5/raylib/releases)
2. Run `make install` in raylib
3. Download the [code](https://github.com/D-Shwagginz/raylib_pong/archive/refs/heads/main.zip)
4. Run 'shards run' from the install directory

## Contributing

1. Fork it (<https://github.com/your-github-user/raylib_pong/fork>)
2. Create your feature branch (`git checkout -b my-new-feature`)
3. Commit your changes (`git commit -am 'Add some feature'`)
4. Push to the branch (`git push origin my-new-feature`)
5. Create a new Pull Request

## Contributors

- D. Shwagginz (https://github.com/D-Shwagginz) - creator
- Sol-vin (https://github.com/sol-vin) - co-creator

def.name: draw
def.body:
Raylib.begin_drawing
Raylib.clear_background(Raylib::WHITE)
Raylib.draw_text(@@player1_score.to_s, 20, 20, 40, Raylib::BLACK)
Raylib.draw_text(@@player2_score.to_s, Raylib.get_screen_width - 40, 20, 40, Raylib::BLACK)
Ball.draw
@@paddle1.draw
@@paddle2.draw
if pause
  Raylib.draw_text("PAUSED", (Raylib.get_screen_width / 2) - 160, (Raylib.get_screen_height / 2) - 60, 80, Raylib::BLACK)
end
Raylib.end_drawing

def.name: run
def.body:
setup
Raylib.init_window(800, 500, "Pong")
Raylib.set_window_state(Raylib::ConfigFlags::WindowResizable)
while !Raylib.close_window?
  update
  draw
end
Raylib.close_window

class_methods.name: setup
class_methods.doc: Sets up the player score procs in ball.
class_methods.summary: Sets up the player score procs in ball.

def.name: setup
def.body:
Ball.on_player1_score = -> do
  @@player1_score = @@player1_score + 1
end
Ball.on_player2_score = -> do
  @@player2_score = @@player2_score + 1
end

class_methods.doc: Updates the game.

def.name: update
def.body:
if pause
else
  update_collision
  Ball.update
  @@paddle1.update
  @@paddle2.update
end
if Raylib.key_pressed?(Raylib::KeyboardKey::Space)
  @@pause = !@@pause
end

class_methods.name: update_collision
class_methods.doc: Updates the collision between paddles and ball.
class_methods.summary: Updates the collision between paddles and ball.

def.name: update_collision
def.body:
if ball_hit_paddle?(paddle1)
  Ball.on_hit_paddle(paddle1)
else
  if ball_hit_paddle?(paddle2)
    Ball.on_hit_paddle(paddle2)
  end
end

abs_position = @@position * Raylib::Vector2.new(x: Raylib.get_screen_width, y: Raylib.get_screen_height)

def.name: on_hit_paddle
def.body:
paddle_point = Raylib::Vector2.new(x: (paddle.position.x + (Paddle::WIDTH / 2)), y: (paddle.position.y + (Paddle::HEIGHT / 2)))
increase_speed
@@velocity = ((@@position - paddle_point).normalize * SPEED) * @@speed_coefficient

def.name: update
def.body:
@@position = @@position + (@@velocity * Raylib.get_frame_time)
wall_hit_check
if Ball.position.x < 0
  on_player2_score.call
  @@velcity = Raylib::Vector2.new(x: -SPEED)
  Ball.reset
else
  if Ball.position.x > 1.0
    on_player1_score.call
    @@velcity = Raylib::Vector2.new(x: SPEED)
    Ball.reset
  end
end

def.name: update
def.body:
if @owner == Player::One
  if Raylib.key_down?(Raylib::KeyboardKey::W)
    move(Direction::Up)
  end
  if Raylib.key_down?(Raylib::KeyboardKey::S)
    move(Direction::Down)
  end
else
  if Raylib.key_down?(Raylib::KeyboardKey::Up)
    move(Direction::Up)
  end
  if Raylib.key_down?(Raylib::KeyboardKey::Down)
    move(Direction::Down)
  end
end
wall_hit_check

instance_methods.name: wall_hit_check
instance_methods.doc: Checks if the paddle has hit a wall and confines it within the play area.
instance_methods.summary: Checks if the paddle has hit a wall and confines it within the play area.

def.name: wall_hit_check
def.body:
if @position.y < 0
  @position.y = 0
else
  if (@position.y + HEIGHT) > 1.0
    @position.y = 1.0 - HEIGHT
  end
end
